topicSummary: Neuropathic pain is a symptom that develops as a result of damage to, or dysfunction of, the nervous system.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Neuropathic pain - drug treatment: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Dysphagia added as an adverse effect of gabapentin.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Gabapentin and pregabalin have now be rescheduled as Schedule 3 Controlled Drugs NHS England, 2019.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: References to amitriptyline being off-label removed.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Change to adverse effects for gabapentin to reflect changes to the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics regarding respiratory disorders.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Addition to adverse effects for pregabalin to reflect changes to the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Based on an update to the manufacturer's Summary of Product Characteristics, hyponatraemia has been included as a possible adverse effect of gabapentin ABPI 2015.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Update to the text to reflect the fact that tramadol has been reclassified to a schedule 3 controlled drug.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in January 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. The following changes were made:
